verses.text: Then said the \sc Lord\sc* unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, \add yet\add* my mind \add could\add* not \add be\add* toward this people: cast \add them\add* out of my sight, and let them go forth.

And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Such as \add are\add* for death, to death; and such as \add are\add* for the sword, to the sword; and such as \add are\add* for the famine, to the famine; and such as \add are\add* for the captivity, to the captivity.
And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the \sc Lord\sc*: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and destroy.
And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for \add that\add* which he did in Jerusalem.
For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest?
Thou hast forsaken me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.
And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave \add them\add* of children, I will destroy my people, \add sith\add* they return not from their ways.

Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused \add him\add* to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors \add upon\add* the city.

She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while \add it was\add* yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor \add men\add* have lent to me on usury; \add yet\add* every one of them doth curse me.
The \sc Lord\sc* said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee \add well\add* in the time of evil, and in the time of affliction.
Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?
Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price, and \add that\add* for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.
And I will make \add thee\add* to pass with thine enemies into a land \add which\add* thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger, \add which\add* shall burn upon you.
O \sc Lord\sc*, thou knowest: remember me, and visit me, and revenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.
Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart: for I am called by thy name, O \sc Lord\sc* God of hosts.
I sat not in the assembly of the mockers, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand: for thou hast filled me \add with\add* indignation.
Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, \add which\add* refuseth to be healed? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar, \add and as\add* waters \add that\add* fail?

Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, \add and\add* thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.

And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall: and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee: for I \add am\add* with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
